current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: To amend the prices set for Federal Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamps and make limited waivers of stamp requirements for certain users.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Migratory Bird Habitat Investment and
			 Enhancement Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

term.#tail:
) were created in 1934 as Federal licenses required for hunting
			 migratory waterfowl;

text.#text:
Federal Migratory
			 Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamps (commonly known as

duck stamps are a vital
			 tool for wetland conservation;

98 percent of the receipts from duck
			 stamp sales are used to acquire important migratory bird breeding, migration,
			 and wintering habitat, which are added to the National Wildlife Refuge System;
			 and

those benefits extend to all wildlife,
			 not just ducks;

since its
			 inception, the Federal duck stamp program has—

generated more
			 than $750,000,000;

preserved more
			 than 5,000,000 acres of wetland and wildlife habitat; and

is considered
			 among the most successful conservation programs ever initiated;

since 1934, when duck
			 stamps cost $1, the price has been increased 7 times to the price in effect on
			 the date of enactment of this Act of $15, which took effect in 1991; and

the price of the duck stamp has not
			 increased since 1991, the longest single period without an increase in program
			 history; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
reports the
			 price of land in targeted wetland areas has tripled from an average of $306 to
			 $1,091 per acre.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: United States Fish and Wildlife Service

text.#text:
with the price
			 unchanged during the 20-year period preceding the date of enactment of this
			 Act, duck stamps have lost 40 percent of their value based on the consumer
			 price index, while the
